Re ''An Ill Wind Off Cape Cod,'' by Robert F. Kennedy Jr. (Op-Ed, Dec. 16):

Mr. Kennedy says the Cape Cod wind power project could harm songbirds and sea ducks, but the draft environmental impact statement released by the Army Corps of Engineers, after three years of scientific study, indicates that it would not materially affect such species.

And while he says there will be a drastic impact on fishing and tourism, the draft statement says ''the project is not anticipated to have substantial impacts on commercial fishing activities'' and ''will likely have a negligible effect on the use of recreational resources and a positive effect on tourism in general.''

And what about the fact that New England faces a serious energy crisis and the threat of rolling blackouts? New England's electric grid operator has warned of the ''urgent need'' for new generating resources and called for the ''aggressive'' development of renewable energy projects like Cape Wind.
Dennis J. Duffy Vice Pres., Cape Wind Associates Boston, Dec. 28, 2005
